benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId} - Retrieve a bundle by id

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01-TC04, TC14, TC16, TC17, TC18) validate successful retrieval for valid bundleId and different audit levels, large payloads and concurrency.
Empty / Not Found Response: TC06 and TC11 cover bundle-not-found cases returning 404.
Query Parameters: TC02-TC05, TC10 exercise valid audit values, unknown query params, and invalid audit values.
Input Validation: TC07 and TC15 cover malformed UUID and injection/XSS attempts producing 400.
Authorization: TC08 and TC09 cover missing and invalid authentication resulting in 401 Unauthorized.
Service and Resilience: TC12 and TC13 cover service-unavailable (503) and network timeout behavior.
Regression / Backward Compatibility: TC16 and TC17 verify case-sensitivity and structure compatibility regressions.
Observability / Recovery: TC20 covers retry behavior on transient 500 errors.
Response Format & Headers: Many scenarios assert Content-Type and JSON Bundle body presence (TC01–TC04, TC14).
gaps: Pagination: No tests related to pagination are present. (Note: the endpoint returns a single bundle by id; pagination may be irrelevant — if the API offers paged sub-resources, tests are missing.)
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests simulate rapid repeated requests to verify rate limit responses (e.g., 429) or backoff behavior.
Caching Behavior: No tests verify caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Authorization scope / permission variants: Tests cover 401 (unauthenticated) but do not cover 403 (authenticated but unauthorized) or role/permission variations that might restrict bundle access.

Error payload schema & error codes consistency: While many error cases are present, there are no assertions on consistent error response schema (fields, error codes) beyond message text for each error case.
Content negotiation / Accept header variants: No tests for different Accept headers or behavior when client requests non-JSON.

Data integrity / deep field validation: The tests assert presence of a Bundle object but lack deep assertions for required Bundle fields, field types, and relationships (e.g., subscriptions array shape, dates, IDs).
Performance SLAs beyond single large-bundle case: Only one performance assertion exists (TC14 < 2s). No load/soak tests or latency percentiles under realistic load.
recommendations: If pagination is applicable for any nested/list sub-resources, add tests covering page size, page number, boundaries (empty page, last page). If not applicable, document that pagination is intentionally N/A for this endpoint.
Add rate-limiting tests that fire bursts of requests and assert appropriate responses (e.g., 429) and client backoff behavior.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify ETag/Cache-Control headers, test If-None-Match returning 304 and ensure payload is not resent when unchanged.
Add authorization scope tests for 403 cases: authenticated users without proper permissions should get 403 and a clear error schema.
Define and assert an error response schema and add checks across all error scenarios to ensure consistency (error code, message, details).
Add content-negotiation tests: request with Accept: application/xml or missing Accept header and assert proper handling (406 or default to JSON per spec).
Improve deep Bundle validation: add assertions for required fields, correct types, relationships (e.g., each subscription has expected fields), and edge cases like nulls in optional fields.
Expand performance tests beyond single large-bundle to include load tests and SLA percentiles under concurrency beyond functional concurrency (TC18).
Add tests for logging/monitoring expectations where required (e.g., that timeout and 500 events are logged with sufficient context).
